intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. glacialis, commonly known as the alpine eyebright, is a member of the Orobanchaceae family. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of yellowish-orange flowers. Native to alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in cool, moist environments at high elevations. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, demonstrating adaptability to harsh mountainous conditions.
